But there are some flaws in the argument. Why would Brett - this random nerdy-looking Californian guyÂ - have Marsellusâ soul? And how do you keep a soul in a briefcase?

A stronger theory would have to involve something else beautiful and glowing with inner light, which also impels people to seek it and even kill for it, which also provides supernatural protection to those who rightfully seek it, but which could fit in a briefcase and which a nerdy Californian might be uniquely skilled at knowing where to find.

My point is, I think Marsellus Wallace has at least one Silmaril.

On further reflection this absolutely checks out.

The apparent incongruity is: Marsellus would have to be one of the Noldor for his Silmaril obsession to make sense. But the Noldor all died or returned to Valinor, so why would one be in 1990s Los Angeles?

But according to Wikipedia:

Maglor, along with Galadriel and Gil-galad, was the greatest surviving Noldo at the beginning of the Second Age. There is speculation that he remained even after the Third Age in Middle-earth, forbidden forever from returning to Valinor.

So Maglor is the one Noldo who could presumably still be on a Silmaril hunt in 1990s LA. And his name in Quenya is MacalaurÃ«, meaning âgold-cleaverâ.

Blessed is he, who in the name of charity and good will, shepherds the weak through the valley of darkness, for he is truly his brotherâs keeper and the finder of lost children. And you will know my name is the Lord when I lay my vengeance upon thee.
